message.content:
cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.EM

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper describes a holistic approach for fault-tolerant network-on-chip based many-core systems, which involves designing the system architecture to incorporate a System Health Monitoring Unit (SHMU) and a Mapper/Scheduler Unit (MSU). 
- cs.ET (Embedded Systems): The paper focuses on fault-tolerant design for embedded systems, specifically for many-core systems that use Network-on-Chip (NoC) communication. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the design of many-core systems, which are inherently parallel and distributed in nature. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper describes a System Health Monitoring Unit (SHMU) that collects fault information and provides solutions for different fault classes, which can be seen as a control system for fault-tolerant design. 
- cs.EM (Emerging Technologies): The paper discusses the use of Network-on-Chip (NoC) communication, which is a relatively new and emerging technology in the field of computer architecture.
